p: B. aegyptiaca produces a variety of secondary metabolites, such as polyphenols (phenolic acids, flavonoids and coumarins), alkaloids, steroids, saponins (spirostanol saponins, furostanol saponins and open-chain steroidal saponins) and pregnane glycosides, isolated from plant tissues, such as fruit, seeds, leaves, stem bark, roots and galls ( Table 5).
